item.title: AXIOMS
item.description: The first of a long series of posts explaining my thoughts on the purpose of education, the nature of the student-teacher relationship, and the problems with modern Western pedagogy.

item.title: ECONOMICS
item.description: The second in an ongoing series of education/pedagogy posts. This one is about refining and defending an economic model of classroom management.

item.title: ANTAGONISTIC LEARNING
item.description: The third in an ongoing series of education/pedagogy posts. This one is about the teacher-student relationshipâ€”in particular, a model which is overrepresented in fiction, and underrepresented in real, everyday classrooms.

item.title: PRIME DIRECTIVE
item.description: In which the only stable time loop that includes a Federation must also include a Prime Directive.

item.title: FLAVORFUL EFFORT
item.description: An examination of positive and negative flavorings in making and executing plans, and an attempt to define the right places for each.

item.title: THE LEVERS OF THE SOUL
item.description: Thinking about the ways in which I move myself, and the levers that let me do it.

item.title: WINNING THE HUMAN RACE
item.description: A Rationality 101 post, drawing on the common framing of the external universe as the "territory" and one's personal understanding of it as the "map."

item.title: QUITTABILITY
item.description: An attempt to identify an underlying principle connecting various failure modes, especially in the realm of "Screw this; I quit."

item.title: VOLUNTARY EFFORT
item.description: An explicit, generalized model of how to motivate others, drawing on insights about motivating myself.
